p: Recently, a SARS-CoV-2 infected patient presented with acute heart failure a week after experiencing “flu-like symptoms” and was diagnosed with acute myocarditis without any interstitial pneumonitis ( 48). It is known that SARS binds to myocardial ACE2 and downregulates myocardial ACE2 protein ( 3). The protective effects of ACE2 in the heart are well-described ( 41, 49) and it is the major metabolic pathway for breakdown of Ang II in the heart ( 50). ACE2 protects the heart from Ang II-AT 1R signaling induced injury ( 34).
